features: Make potty-training magical with NEW My Little Pony Pampers Easy Ups Training Pants
360 stretchy waistband for easy pull up and down
Up to 100% leakproof with Dual Leak-Guard Barriers
Extra Absorb Channels quickly lock wetness away from skin
body.description: Pampers Easy Ups training pants – featuring your favorite My Little Pony characters – are a fun and easy way to prepare for underwear. Our dynamic 360° Stretchy Waistband moves with your toddler for a fit that's just like the real thing and helps them pull up and down their training pants with ease. Pampers Easy Ups are the only training pants with Extra Absorb Channels for outstanding Pampers Leak Protection, all day AND night. Pampers Easy Ups training pants are super soft, like cotton underwear. Plus, they have Dual Leak-Guard Barriers to prevent pesky leaks — so they can dance and sing the day away with complete confidence. With Easy-Tear Sides for super-fast removal and Trolls 2 underwear designs on the front and back, your toddler will feel like they're wearing real underwear. You'll know it's Pampers.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Wish potty training was easier? Give them a choice! Potty training is tough, but here’s a little secret: when you let your child choose, it’s easy. Set up for potty-training success Before potty-training, make sure your toddler is ready by talking with your pediatrician and checking out the info below. Next, start a potty routine after meals and before naps and bedtime. Give your toddler a choice Toddlers love to be involved. You can let them help pick out their training pants at the store, or things like their prizes, potty seat, and where they go at home. A little ownership goes a long way!

Encourage & Reward with Their Favorite Pals Make potty training encouraging and rewarding with sticker charts, high fives and small rewards along the way. Use your toddler’s favorite characters as their potty pals along the journey.

What sizes do Pampers Easy Ups come in? Pampers Easy Ups training underwear come in four sizes: 2T–3T (16–34 lb), 3T–4T (30–40 lb), 4T–5T (37+ lb) and 5T–6T (41+ lb). How do Pampers Easy Ups help prevent leaks? Easy Ups offer the same great Pampers protection you’ve come to love. Extra Absorb Channels protect against leaks, day or night, by locking wetness away from your toddler’s skin. Dual Leak-Guard Barriers also help stop leaks where they happen most. Can I use Easy Ups for nighttime protection? Yes! Pampers Easy Ups provide up to 12 hours of protection to help prevent leaks day and night. Can my son wear Easy Ups with Trolls designs? Can my daughter wear Easy Ups with PJ Masks designs? Yes! Pampers Easy Ups are designed with absorbency to meet both boys’ and girls’ needs, just like diapers. Your toddler can wear either design they choose! Are Easy Ups right for my child? Yes! Easy Ups are specially designed for potty training with our 360° stretchy waistband for a soft, comfortable fit. They look and feel just like real underwear and are easy for your toddler to pull up and down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Affordable and absorb!
reviews.reviewText: I love that these are affordable but they actually work. We have used ones like Parents Choice from Walmart in a pinch and our kids pee through. These are the same quality as huggies. Our kids have never made it through!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Our families go to trainign pants
reviews.reviewText: I'm using this for my second child now and am very happy with the pampers easy ups. My children both were very comfortable wearing these to sleep. leaking incidents rarely happen and when they do its usually because the easy up has been on for over 12 hours (overnight.) The easy ups also come off easily by tearing the 2 side seems, which makes it so much easier to use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Just when my 4 year old started refusing nighttime diapers I found these! I liked everything about them including the design because my daughter is obsessed with the ponies. The ruching on the sides is more comfortable than the resealable Velcro and actually stays in tact better. If you need to take them off and on you have to do it over the feet tho so there's the sacrifice. But well worth it for us because she doesn't wear them all the time, because she's mostly potty trained. When we go for a long car ride or a long day out around the city or something I put her in one to be safe, especially because she doesn't like public bathrooms. So I was using these during the day and using Huggies overnight diapers for overnight. However I was looking for a pull-up style overnight because my daughter started refusing diapers altogether and demanding to wear these to bed because they're much more comfortable. I gave in and there were some times she couldn't get to the potty in time during the night and went in these. They didn't leak!!! As I searched for overnight pullups these popped up and I actually see that they are designed to be worn at night as well!! They are 12 hour safe. So it was nice I just put her in these at night too! She doesn't go through a ton but maybe 5 per week so the value is great. I got the boy version for my 3 year old which are the PJ Mask characters and he loves those as well and doesn't leak either. Overall thrilled to have these and will use with my baby on the way much younger now with him, probably start him on these at 1!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helped my daughter pottie train
reviews.reviewText: Oh, Pampers Easy Ups, where have you been all my parenting life? These training underwear for girls are like the superhero capes of potty training – making the journey from diapers to big kid undies a breeze, or should I say a gentle breeze of floral freshness.Let's talk about convenience. These Easy Ups are easier to put on than my socks, and that's saying something. It's like a tiny victory every time my little one decides it's potty time, and we don't have to wrestle with complicated diaper tabs. I swear, these training undies practically pull themselves up – maybe there's a hidden pair of helping hands inside. If only adult underwear were this cooperative!Now, let's address the elephant in the room – the adorable designs. Pampers, did you hire a team of toddler fashionistas to create these prints? My kid thinks she's wearing a wearable art gallery, and I have to admit, I'm a bit jealous. From princesses to animals having dance parties, these Easy Ups turn potty training into a fashion show. Move over, Paris Fashion Week – we've got Potty Fashion Week in my house!And can we talk about the absorbency? It's like these training undies have a PhD in handling little accidents. They've saved my couch from more mini floods than I can count, and I'm convinced they come with a built-in magic shield against leaks. Pampers, are you sure these aren't made by wizards?But let's not forget the star of the show – the "You Did It!" indicator. This is like the toddler version of a gold star. When my little one sees that magical disappearing design, it's like she just won the potty Olympics. I've never seen someone so proud of a wet diaper turning into a dry one – it's like witnessing a magical transformation, complete with a toddler victory dance.In conclusion, Pampers Easy Ups Training Underwear for Girls are not just undies; they're a parenting sidekick. They make potty training feel like a walk in the park, a park filled with laughter, adorable prints, and a touch of magic. If you're on the potty training journey, these Easy Ups are the golden ticket – or should I say the golden pull-up – to success. Diapers, meet your stylish and absorbent successor!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for Active Toddlers
reviews.reviewText: My 2 year old son is still not potty trained. These pull up diapers fit him perfectly and do not cause chaffing or sensory issues. He can even wear them overnight without a worry of leaking. They are easy to pull up and down and I imagine when he is ready they should make potty training a breeze because of this. Another great thing about these training diapers is that they have a few larger size options. My son is about 30 pounds and still fits in the 2t/3t size. He also fits in the 3t/4t without leaks as well, so I do not have to worry about the awkward transition between sizes when the time comes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love everything about these pull-ups, but do have to watch overnight if your child has a heavy bladder and pees all at once, but as potty training is usually during the day these are great

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great pull ups great price
reviews.reviewText: We use these on a regular with my grandson and the price and quick shipping from prime is the best deal just yet even when compared to Sam’s club. That makes me want to use prime even more. These diapers hold stuff in that you don’t want getting out so no complaints there. The design my grandson loves so win win. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 2nd time mom and these haven't failed me yet
reviews.reviewText: I've used these on both my kids and they haven't failed me yet they fit nice and are easy to put on. My kids love the fun designs. They don't tear easy which makes them great for a toddler on the go. Over all they're a wonderful choice
Están bonitos y de buena calidad
I love these better than pulls ups , soft , lasts, easy to use love it !
Trying to potty train is hard but this is a great product to use.
Lo recomiendo ampliamente hasta ahorita ha sido el único pañal que no le rosa en su pierna soporta mucho la humedad aparte son lindos, no duden de estos pañales vale la pena la inversión

No me decidía a comprarlos porque mi hijo aun no está en etapa de control de esfinteres tiene 1 año 3 meses sin embargo me encantó!!! Absorbe igual que un pañal y el ajuste me encanta. Pesa 11.180 kilos y le queda bien no le aprieta en ningún lado, no hemos tenido fugas ni de noche
